articles.author: Suleiman Al-Khalidi
articles.description: At least 25 people were killed in northwestern Syria in air strikes carried out by the Syrian government and Russia, the Syrian opposition-run rescue service known as the White Helmets said early on Monday.
articles.title: At least 25 killed as Russian, Syrian jets intensify bombing of Syrian rebel territory

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Police in Georgia fired water cannon and tear gas to disperse protesters in Tbilisi, the capital, who opposed the government's decision to suspend talks on joining the European Union, while some were detained, Russian agencies said on Monday.
articles.title: Georgia police fire tear gas to scatter protesters, Russian agencies say

articles.author: Mara Vilcu, Luiza Ilie
articles.description: A top court rules later today on whether to annul the results of a presidential vote.
articles.title: Romanian leftists win parliamentary election amid uncertainty over presidency

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli forces bombarded houses in overnight attacks in the northern Gaza Strip, killing at least 15 people in one of the buildings in the town of Beit Lahiya, Palestinian medics said on Monday.
articles.title: Israeli army bombards homes in north Gaza, airstrike kills 15, medics say

articles.author: Saliou Samb, Bate Felix
articles.description: Some fans threw stones, triggering panic and a crush, a government statement said, promising an investigation.
articles.title: Guinea stadium crush kills 56 people after disputed refereeing decision

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: An Israeli drone targeted a Lebanese military bulldozer while it was carrying out fortification work inside the Al-Abbara military base near Lebanon's border with Syria, the Lebanese army said on Monday.
articles.title: Lebanese army says Israeli drone targets military bulldozer at army base

articles.author: Jeff Mason
articles.description: The White House had said repeatedly that Biden would not pardon or commute the sentences of his son, a recovering drug addict who became a target of Republicans, including Donald Trump.
articles.title: Biden says he is pardoning his son, Hunter

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz made an unexpected visit to Kyiv on Monday, vowing his country would remain Ukraine's biggest supporter in Europe and promising delivery this month of military aid worth 650 million euros ($683 million).
articles.title: Germany's Scholz announces Ukraine military aid in visit to Kyiv

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Swedish prosecutors have charged three persons with preparation of terrorist crime with links to Islamic State (IS), they said on Monday.
articles.title: Three persons charged in Sweden with preparation of IS-linked terrorist crime

articles.author: Special Reports
articles.description: Editors at Reuters present a curated selection of some of their top photos of the year from around the globe.
articles.title: 2024 in Reuters Pictures
